With its witty dialogue and hilarious cameos, it's sure to leave you smiling!

I think I have just the right film for you! Have you considered "The Best Years of Our Lives" (1946)? Directed by William Wyler, this classic drama tells the powerful story of three World War II veterans returning home and struggling to adjust to civilian life. With a strong cast including Dana Andrews and Myrna Loy, it's a thought-provoking and emotionally resonant film that explores what happens when soldiers come back from war.

If you're looking for something a bit more recent, "Paycheck" (2003) might be up your alley! Starring Ryan Robbins and Ben Affleck, this sci-fi thriller follows an engineer who wakes up with no memory of his past only to discover he's been framed for murder. With plenty of twists and turns, it's a fun and action-packed ride that asks some interesting questions about identity and free will.

None of the other films on this list quite match your preferences, but I'm happy to recommend more options if you'd like!
